summary: This bill, the Association Health Plans Act, amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA). It clarifies that groups or associations of employers can be treated as employers for the purpose of establishing and maintaining employee welfare benefit plans, including group health plans.  The bill lays out criteria for these associations, including minimum employee numbers, provisions against health status discrimination, and board governance requirements. It also specifies rules for premium rates, discrimination, pre-existing condition protections, and self employed individuals.
